private_information: I know the full catalog of actions and their informal preconditions and effects derived from the playbook.
I have access to the two experimental initial-state statements and the two corresponding goals and proposed plans described in the use-case.
planner.goal: Analyze the action schemas, check applicability of the supplied plans to the given initial statements, and produce a concise action-schema report and plan validation summary.

private_information: I focus on temporal and causal consistency and on removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties.
I will identify any implicit bookkeeping or short-cuts in plans and propose conservative semantic repairs that preserve intended causal effects.
auditor.goal: Audit the planner's schemas and plan validation summary and produce a corrected causal/temporal model and remediation suggestions.

private_information: I specialize in identity collision detection, object index sanity, and inter-statement name mismatches.
I will check that object identifiers are used consistently and detect ambiguous references across statements and plans.
verifier.goal: Verify the auditor-corrected model for naming consistency and produce a compact consistency report.

private_information: I will integrate the analyses and produce the final PDDL domain and problem files formatted for the FastDownwards planner.
I keep agent actions distinct in the produced PDDL and target STRIPS-style PDDL compatible with FastDownwards.
orchestrator.goal: Assemble the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that encodes the environment, the corrected action schemas, and the specified goal.

public_information: Objects exist named object_0 through object_11 and additional collect relations referencing indices up to object_10.
Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Action paltry preconditions: hand OBJ0, cats OBJ1, texture OBJ2, vase OBJ0 OBJ1, next OBJ1 OBJ2. Action paltry add effects: next OBJ0 OBJ2. Action paltry del effects: vase OBJ0 OBJ1.
Action sip preconditions: hand OBJ0, cats OBJ1, texture OBJ2, next OBJ0 OBJ2, next OBJ1 OBJ2. Action sip add effects: vase OBJ0 OBJ1. Action sip del effects: next OBJ0 OBJ2.
Action clip preconditions: hand OBJ0, sneeze OBJ1, texture OBJ2, next OBJ1 OBJ2, next OBJ0 OBJ2. Action clip add effects: vase OBJ0 OBJ1. Action clip del effects: next OBJ0 OBJ2.

Action wretched preconditions: sneeze OBJ0, texture OBJ1, texture OBJ2, stupendous OBJ3, next OBJ0 OBJ1, collect OBJ1 OBJ3, collect OBJ2 OBJ3. Action wretched add effects: next OBJ0 OBJ2. Action wretched del effects: next OBJ0 OBJ1.
Action memory preconditions: cats OBJ0, spring OBJ1, spring OBJ2, next OBJ0 OBJ1. Action memory add effects: next OBJ0 OBJ2. Action memory del effects: next OBJ0 OBJ1.
Action tightfisted preconditions: hand OBJ0, sneeze OBJ1, texture OBJ2, next OBJ1 OBJ2, vase OBJ0 OBJ1. Action tightfisted add effects: next OBJ0 OBJ2. Action tightfisted del effects: vase OBJ0 OBJ1.

Statement A initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_3 object_7, next object_4 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Statement A goal: next object_11 object_10.
Statement A proposed plan sequence contains 11 actions including wretched, clip, tightfisted, memory, sip, paltry steps using various object indices as in the provided plan.

Statement B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, next object_0 object_5, next object_11 object_8, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Statement B goal: next object_11 object_9.
Plans and statements may include implicit bookkeeping and object aliasing that must be resolved before PDDL generation.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert domain modeler who will analyze the action catalog, produce concise formal action schemas with typed parameter placeholders and list the minimal preconditions and effects for each action, and validate the supplied plans against the two statement initial states and goals. Do not emit PDDL domain or problem files. Provide a short plan validation summary referencing any missing assumptions or ambiguous object usages.
analysis.prompt: Your name is planner. Use the environment public information and your private information to extract formal action schemas, identify where preconditions or effects are underspecified, and validate the given plans against the given initial facts and goals. Report all assumptions explicitly.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an auditor specializing in temporal and causal consistency and removal of bookkeeping shortcuts. Given a planner analysis, you will detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts, propose conservative repairs, and produce a causal model with explicit resource accounting and no hidden tokens or post-hoc penalties. Output a remediation report and an adjusted set of preconditions and effects if needed.
analysis.prompt: Your name is auditor. Given the planner_analysis and the environment public information, audit causal orderings, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce a remediation report describing changes needed to make the model temporally and causally explicit.

check.system_prompt: You are a verifier whose role is identity and naming consistency validation across statements and plans. You will detect object aliasing, index collisions, and inconsistent use of identifiers and produce a compact list of renamings or disambiguation rules that must be applied before PDDL generation.
check.prompt: Your name is verifier. Use the planner_analysis and auditor_report plus the environment public information to check naming consistency and propose a ready-to-apply disambiguation map or a declaration that names are consistent.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and FastDownwards. Integrate the planner_analysis, auditor_report, and verifier_report into a final PDDL domain and a final PDDL problem file targeted at the FastDownwards solver. Use STRIPS-style constructs and standard predicates for next, hand, cats, texture, vase, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect. Keep actions distinct per agent analytic origin if appropriate. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not output extraneous commentary.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the incoming analysis artifacts, resolve any auditor recommended repairs and verifier renamings, and emit a ready-to-run PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards that encodes Statement A or Statement B as selected by the user. If both statements are present, provide options or a parameterized problem and document which statement is encoded.
